metadata.description: US Consumer Price Index | Value 02/26 | March 2026 Release

outcome_space.description: US Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U)

base_case.condition: What will the US Consumer Price Index (CPI-U) be for {observation.reference_date}?
base_case.fsp_resolution: FSP equals the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U) index value for the month of {observation.reference_date}, as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics in the Consumer Price Index report released on {observation.release_date}. The CPI-U measures the average change over time in prices paid by urban consumers for a market basket of consumer goods and services, with a reference base period of 1982-84=100, Seasonally Adjusted. This data is available via the FRED API (Series ID: CPIAUCSL).

edge_cases.condition: The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics announces that it cannot produce the CPI-U for {observation.reference_date} due to exceptional circumstances (such as government shutdown) but provides an alternative estimate or proxy value.
edge_cases.fsp_resolution: FSP = the alternative estimate or proxy value provided by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics.

edge_cases.condition: The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics announces that it cannot produce the CPI-U for {observation.reference_date} due to exceptional circumstances and will not publish one for this period.
edge_cases.fsp_resolution: FSP = {oracle_fallback.fallback_fsp}, the most recent CPI-U value available prior to the scheduled release date of {observation.release_date}.

oracle_config.description: Prototype1 oracle configuration for CPI-U data retrieval from FRED API
